com.persistit

Class AlertMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.management.NotificationBroadcasterSupport
      • com.persistit.AlertMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AlertMonitorMXBean, NotificationBroadcaster, NotificationEmitter

    public final class AlertMonitor
extends NotificationBroadcasterSupport
implements AlertMonitorMXBean

    Manage the process of accumulating and logging abnormal events such as IOExceptions and measurements outside of expected thresholds. This class notifies agents by (a) writing log messages and (b) sending JMX Notifications.

    This mechanism is designed to organize events generated by background threads, sometimes very frequently. For example, if a disk fails, the JOURNAL_FLUSHER thread may receive many IOExceptions per second. These are treated as Events in this class, and log messages are written periodically but far less frequently. But in addition, this class is also capable of sending a Notification to a management client which may be useful in making the problem known in a timely fashion

    Events are collated by category names. For each category value there is a separate AlertMonitor.History of events pertaining to that category. By separately aggregating events of different categories this class avoids discarding important, but older events belonging to one category when receiving new events in a different category. For example, IOExceptions generated frequently by the JOURNAL_FLUSHER do not overwrite previous events indicating that the JOURNAL_COPIER has fallen behind.

    Author:
    peter

    • Method Detail

      • post

        public final void post(AlertMonitor.Event event,
        String category)
        Post an event. If necessary, create a AlertMonitor.History for the specified category and then add the event to it. Subsequently, poll the History to cause any pending notifications or log messages to be emitted.
        Parameters:
        event - A Event object describing what happened
        category - A String describing the nature of the event. A separate event-history is maintained for each unique category.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Restore this alert monitor to level AlertMonitor.AlertLevel.NORMAL with and remove all histories for all categories. The logging time intervals and history length are not changed.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface AlertMonitorMXBean

        public AlertMonitor.History getHistory(String name)

        the History for that category or null if the specified category has no History.

      • getHistoryMap

        public SortedMap<String,AlertMonitor.History> getHistoryMap()
        Returns:
        Map sorted by category name of all History elements.

      • setHistoryLength

        public void setHistoryLength(int historyLength)
        Set the number of Events per category to keep in the History. Once the number of events exceeds this count, earlier events are removed when new events are added. (However, the first Event added is retained and get accessed via AlertMonitor.History.getFirstEvent() even when subsequent Events are removed.) The default value is 10.
        Specified by:
        setHistoryLength in interface AlertMonitorMXBean
        Parameters:
        historyLength - the historyLength to set

      • getAlertRecordArray

        public AlertMonitor.AlertRecord[] getAlertRecordArray()
        Generate a list of event data suitable for the Akiban Server in-memory tables implementation.
        Returns:
        List of AlertRecord elements.

        Called periodically to issue any pending log messages or notifications.

        Parameters:
        force - Indicates whether to issue pending log messages and notifications prior to expiration of their respective notification time intervals.

      • getDetailedHistory

        public String getDetailedHistory(String select)
        Description copied from interface: AlertMonitorMXBean

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a detailed history report for the specified category
